The Bodhisattva Luminous Appearance said:

The nature of the four elements is precisely the nature of the emptiness element. As the past and future are empty, so is the present.
If one can understand the nature of the various elements in this way, this is entering the gate of non-duality.
The Bodhisattva Wonderful Intention said:

In the same way, ear and sound, nose and smell, tongue and taste, body and touch, and mind and dharmas are two. If one knows the nature of the mind, one is neither greedy, hateful, nor deluded towards dharmas. This is called quiescence. Abiding in this is entering the gate of non-duality.
The Bodhisattva Inexhaustible Intent said:

The nature of wisdom is the nature of dedicating to omniscience. Entering the one characteristic within this is entering the gate of non-duality.

One who is able to follow the wisdom of non-action in this way enters the gate of non-duality.

One who does not give rise to these three actions enters the gate of non-duality.
